title: Driver approaches student at Belair Primary School
text:
Police are investigating an incident at a southern suburbs primary school where a student was approached by a man in a ute.

The unknown man approached the female Belair Primary School student on Rokewood Ave about 8.30am on Wednesday.

The driver of the white ute stayed in the vehicle and briefly spoke to the girl before driving off.

The vehicle had orange flashing lights on top.

Police have described the man as having brown and grey hair.

Police are seeking dashcam footage of the road at that time.

It is unclear what the man said to the child.

Principal Rob Houston in a letter sent to parents said teachers had discussed the incident with their classes.

“You might like to reinforce this message at home,” he wrote.

“This could include making it clear to your child who within your circle of family and

friends is trusted to do the school drop off and pick up.

“If students are feeling vulnerable the advice is to go back to school, to a place of

business or to make contact with a trusted adult.”

Anyone with information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: A primary school student has been approached by an unknown man driving a ute. Police are seeking dashcam footage.
